conclusion: Determine when the two objects meet by finding the time when their positions are equal.
Positions can be found by integrating their velocity functions with respect to time.
Identify the velocity functions for both objects as the area under the curves of v_A(t) and v_B(t).
Determine the position functions by integrating the velocity functions.
Set up the equation s_A(t) = s_B(t) for when the positions are equal.
Integrate the velocity functions to find the position functions.
For Object A, s_A(t) is the integral of v_A(t) with respect to time.
For Object B, s_B(t) is the integral of v_B(t) with respect to time.
Find the time t when s_A(t) = s_B(t) by observing the graph.
From the graph, the two curves intersect at t = t_3.
Verify the intersection point by checking if the areas under the curves are equal at t = t_3.
The two objects meet at t = t_3.
